dismissalText.commentary: Adam Gilchrist lbw b Brown 46 (55b 7x4 0x6 71m) SR: 83.63

dismissalComment.html: Dougie nails Gilchrist. Scotland fielders mob the bowler. Plumb in front. Full and straight on the middle stump line, Gilchrist tries to swing it across the line on a bent knee. No wood on leather and the ball thuds into the pad. Dead duck.

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Hussey st Smith b Hoffmann 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Colin Smith .... you beauty. Smart work behind the stumps. Full in length and angling away, Hussey makes no contact with his intended drive and his back foot is in the air. Smith gathers and quickly whips off the bails even as Hussey  tries to get his foot down. Too close to call. Referred upstairs and after numerous viewings it has been given out. correctly at that.

headshotImage.caption: Brad Hogg player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brad Hogg player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Sharp turn there! Cleans up Smith. Lands outside off stump and spins back sharply. He shapes to cut but is surprised by the turn and its all over. Good outing for Smith. This is the 48th instance of a batsman registering 50+ score on World Cup debut.
Since Blain is injured and  won't bat, Australia have sealed up a facile win.

dismissalText.commentary: Dougie Brown c Watson b Hodge 19 (37b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 51.35

dismissalComment.html: Joy for Hodge. Maiden ODI wicket. Tossed up and Dougie Brown couldn't resist a hit. Sends it down the throat of Watson at long on.

headshotImage.caption: Glenn McGrath player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Glenn McGrath player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Played on! McGrath gets yet another ODI victim. Lands on a length, just outside off, comes in a touch and Watts plays with soft hands. Too soft and it rolls back to the off stump.
Surprise bouncer. Not a surprising result. Right at the throat and Watson is unable to get away from it. Ends up fending a dolly to Bracken at short fine leg
Wicket no 48, in the World Cup games,  for Pigeon! Typical Mcgrath delivery. A teaser on the off stump line and Hamilton is sucked into a fatal prod.

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ripper! Full ball this time and swinging in from outside off. Poonia tries to get his bat down in time but can only end up playing all over it. Ball beats him for pace and clatters into the middle and leg stumps. Too fast and too furious.

Gone. That's much better. Full and straight and screaming quick. Wright shuffles across the crease and is a sitting duck in front of the wicket. Struck on the pads and Asoka de Silva has no hesitation in giving the decision. Plumb as it gets. Tait strikes

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Clarke misses a run-out but McGrath does it! Punched to cover and they set off for a run. Clarke fires in a throw at the non-striker's end, the batsman had given up but the ball misses the sticks. They run for overthrows. They turn greedy, they want two of them but Haq can' t beat McGrath's throw. He was looking pretty good in the middle but he has to get back to the hutch now.

commentTextItems.html: Sharp turn there! Cleans up Smith. Lands outside off stump and spins back sharply. He shapes to cut but is surprised by the turn and its all over. Good outing for Smith. This is the 48th instance of a batsman registering 50+ score on World Cup debut.
Since Blain is injured and  won't bat, Australia have sealed up a facile win.

commentPostTextItems.html: This is the third time in World Cup history that a team has won with a 200+ margin. England achieved it against India in the first edition and then Australia did it against Namibia in 2003.  Good outing for Australia: runs for the top order and wickets for Glenn McGrath.

commentTextItems.html: A run out! offcutter on the off stump line, pushed towards Hayden who rushes in from point and  rolls it along the ground to Gilchrist - lost some time there but still fast enough to catch the batsman short.

commentTextItems.html: pushed to left of Ponting at cover who has a shy at non-striker's end.
full in length, on the off and middle, drives and gets an outside edge to point
full in length, outside off, pushed to left of cover and they will get a single
sliding down the off stump line, nudged to point
beaten flirting outside off and Gilchrist whips off the bails but the batsman had not left his castle.

headshotImage.caption: Brad Hogg player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brad Hogg player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: fifty up for Smith. His colleagues in the pavilion stand up to applaud. Scottish fans in the arena clear their lungs. Maiden fifty. Only the second Scottish batsman to get a fifty in WC. On the legs and swept away to long leg
googly, well picked up and dabbed to backward point region
turns in quickly, from outside off, gets through the bat and pad gap and runs off the back thigh towards short thirdman region
slow through the air, drifts away and lands outside off, turns in, prodded away
slightly short, on the off and middle, punched back to Hodge

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Tait player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: closer to the off stump and pushed back down the track
bit of drift away and lands well outside off, SMith reaches out for it, is beaten by the drift, jabs it away
short in length, outside off, keeps a touch low, and punched to cover
pushes it outside off, Rogers gets across, taps it to cover  region for a single
on the off stump line, Rogers pushes it back to the bowler

dismissalComment.html: Sharp turn there! Cleans up Smith. Lands outside off stump and spins back sharply. He shapes to cut but is surprised by the turn and its all over. Good outing for Smith. This is the 48th instance of a batsman registering 50+ score on World Cup debut.

dismissalComment.html: Clarke misses a run-out but McGrath does it! Punched to cover and they set off for a run. Clarke fires in a throw at the non-striker's end, the batsman had given up but the ball misses the sticks. They run for overthrows. They turn greedy, they want two of them but Haq can' t beat McGrath's throw. He was looking pretty good in the middle but he has to get back to the hutch now.

milestones.description: John Blain has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (19) for SCOT, going past Hamilton
Dougie Brown has conceded the most runs in an innings (86) in ODIs for SCOT, going past Ross Lyons's record of 74
This is the highest match aggregate (465) involving teams Australia & Scotland in ODIs
